title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.6 | 08-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: This is the perfect remedy for the suffering of the conditioned souls: the process of devotional service.
segments.summary: The lecture begins by discussing Vyasadeva's vision of the Lord and His energies, highlighting devotional service as the perfect remedy for the suffering of conditioned souls, emphasizing hearing and chanting as the beginning of this process.
segments.transcript: In this session, we will be discussing from the 6th verse of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam: अनर्थो पशमं साक्षाद भक्ति योगं अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अजानतो विद्वाम्स चक्रे सात्वत सम्हिताम. अनर्थो पशमं साक्षाद भक्ति योगं अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे लोकस्य अधोक्षजे. थे, इस वर्क में हम impactful 的 बार जो कहते है कि, स्थित पत्र वर्क में, वैकुल पर पत्र विशेष निर्मण हो रही या बीम करती है Monte है वर्क में अपने वेसिड युद की वर्क है कि वो अक्सर वर्क हाथवटि में स्कूल है. यह it is complete and perfect in all respects, so when it is described that Vyasadeva saw the personality of Godhead, it is qualified; he saw the all-perfect personality of Godhead. Now, Srila Prabhupada further explains, what does it mean? This statement suggests that the complete unit of the personality of Godhead includes his parts and parcels also. The Lord is always complete, and he is never without his parts and parcels. He saw therefore, what all did he see? He saw therefore his different energies, namely the internal energy, the marginal energy, and the external energy. The Lord is always with his energies, so Vyasadeva, when he saw the Lord, he saw his different energies also. He also saw his different plenary portions and parts of the plenary portions, namely his different incarnations also. Even though the Supreme Lord is one, one and only Supreme Personality of Godhead, but he is not a limited person. He has many different forms of incarnations, plenary portions, parts of plenary portions, and Vyasadeva also specifically observed the unwanted miseries of the conditioned souls who are bewildered by the external energy. This was explained in the previous verse, and here the remedial measure is given, and at last he saw the Lord, and here the remedial measure is given, and at last he saw the Lord, and at last he saw the Lord, and at last he saw the remedial measure for the conditioned souls, namely the process of devotional service. This is the perfect remedy for the suffering of the conditioned souls. What is it? It is the process of devotional service. This devotional service is a great transcendental science and begins with the process of hearing and chanting, and begins with the process of hearing and chanting the name, fame, glory, etc. of the Supreme Personality of Godhead: shravanam, kirtanam, vishnom. This is the beginning of the process of devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Bhakti is something that is bestowed by the Supreme Lord when the Lord is fully satisfied with the sincere efforts of the devotee.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes that devotional service should not be mechanical but involve the full mind and spirit, highlighting the importance of sincerity and the causeless mercy of the Lord in bestowing love of God, and noting the immediate mitigation of material miseries as a benefit of devotional service.
segments.transcript: Revival of the dormant affection or love of Godhead does not depend on the mechanical system of hearing and chanting. Generally, people, when they do something repeatedly, the process tends to become mechanical, just like routinely we do so many things very mechanically. But the process of devotional service is never a mechanical process because it is the full involvement of the mind, because it is the full involvement of the mind, the full involvement of the spirit soul, of the spiritual personality, 100% involved in this process, then only the process is effective to the extent of achieving perfection. Even if somebody does devotional service in a mechanical way, there is benefit, there is a benefit, but it is not sufficient to take us to perfection. So Shrila Prabhupada says this transcendental process, it solely and wholly depends on the causeless mercy of the Lord. Bhakti is something that is bestowed by the Supreme Lord. When the Lord is fully satisfied with the sincere efforts of the devotee, he may endow him with his loving transcendental service. So the complete perfection comes after the devotee has rendered devotional service with all his efforts, sincerely trying to please the Lord, and when the Lord is pleased, he bestows the perfection of love of God. But even with the prescribed forms of hearing and chanting, that is just one has begun, there is at once mitigation of the superfluous and unwanted miseries of material existence. The effect on the heart of the chanting and hearing is immediately felt even by the beginner before he is able to even make advancement. Immediately, what is the immediate effect? The mitigation of material miseries. This is very important to understand, and it is a very great encouragement for anyone that immediately they begin to feel the benefit of this process.

segments.key_quote: Devotion helps us to awaken knowledge within our heart.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the path of knowledge with the path of devotion, stating that devotion is independent of knowledge and helps awaken it, and emphasizes the need for purification from material contamination accumulated over lifetimes to experience transcendental love, explaining that material miseries are superfluous and the material body is unwanted.
segments.transcript: Such mitigation of material affection does not wait for development of transcendental knowledge. This is what the impersonalists think, that unless there is knowledge, there is no progress in spiritual life. That is for the jnana process. Bhakti process does not depend on development of transcendental knowledge. So the Prabhupada says, rather knowledge is dependent on devotional service for the ultimate realization of the supreme truth. So knowledge is dependent on devotion, but devotion is independent of knowledge. Devotion helps us to awaken knowledge within our heart. So the process of devotional service, it directly acts on the contaminated consciousness to purify, but the devotee has to sincerely engage in the process and patiently engage in the process and patiently wait for complete purification. The complete purification takes some time because we have been associating with this material world for a very, very, very long time, millions of lifetimes, and we have accumulated so much of this material contamination life after life after life after life after life. In ignorance, we have been simply engaging in sense gratification, so that has to be cleansed away before we can actually experience the transcendental love in reciprocation with the Supreme Lord. Before that, we have to cleanse the heart. These material miseries are described as superfluous. Superfluous means they are actually not giving any benefit for us. They are simply useless stuff. That's why they are called un-earth. In fact, un-earth means unwanted, something which is unwanted. Un-earth, this body itself, material body itself is un-earth, it itself is un-earth. But in the material conception, we think we cannot exist without the body. Why? Because the body is the means for our sense gratification, for our material enjoyment. That material enjoyment, yes, we can have to whatever extent we can get some material pleasure by the means of the body, but as spirit soul, we are not meant to enjoy materially. Neither material pleasures give any satisfaction for the soul.

segments.key_quote: Material pleasure is simply a sensation, and it is a temporary thing... and it eventually leads to miseries only; whereas transcendental happiness is completely pure bliss and it is never momentary.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the soul's true satisfaction, contrasting material pleasures, which are temporary and lead to misery, with transcendental happiness, which is pure, eternal bliss experienced through transcendental senses, referencing the Bhagavad Gita to support this point.
segments.transcript: The Bhagavatam raises this point: what ensures that there is complete satisfaction for the soul? The satisfaction of the soul, of the real self, that is to be considered. The satisfaction of the soul is never possible by any material pleasure, material means, material methods, material pleasures, material arrangements. It never even touches the soul in any way. So therefore, people who are seeking real happiness, they are frustrated when they make different arrangements for enjoying materially, or they seek material happiness, and they never are satisfied within their heart, never are satisfied. So this point is explained in the Bhagavad Gita: yehi samsparishya ja bhoga dukha yonaya evate aadyantavan takaunteya nateshu ramate budhah. One more verse that explains what is the nature of transcendental happiness: sukham aatyantikam yatta buddhikrahyam atindriyam. You see, this transcendental happiness is an experience of boundless transcendental joy which is experienced with transcendental senses, atindriyam, not with this material senses. These material senses are useless for experiencing any any spiritual happiness or transcendental happiness. So material pleasure is simply a sensation, and it is a temporary thing. It is also called chapala sukha, momentary happiness, and it eventually leads to miseries only, whereas transcendental happiness completely pure bliss, and it is never momentary. So I will stop here. Thank you very much.
